item.title: Embargo 1100 EDT Power Integrations 与 Nvidia 携手推动电源发展
item.description: 提供电源处理芯片的利基芯片制造商 Power Integrations 周一表示，它正与 Nvidia 合作，推动这家人工智能巨头让数据中心在更高电压下运行。【原文：Power Integrations, a niche chipmaker that provides chips for handling power, on Monday said it is working with Nvidia on the artificial intelligence giant's push to make data centers operate at higher voltages.】

item.title: 电信运营商批准 eSIM 服务后，iPhone Air 将在中国开始预购
item.description: 苹果公司周一表示，随着中国主要电信运营商获得 eSIM 服务的监管批准，苹果的 iPhone Air 将于本周晚些时候在中国开始预购。【原文：Apple's iPhone Air would be available for pre-order in China later this week, as major Chinese telecom operators obtained regulatory approvals for eSIM services, the company said on Monday.】

item.title: 亚马逊连续第三年在假日季招聘 25 万名员工
item.description: 亚马逊表示，计划在假期期间为其在美国的履约和运输网络招聘 25 万名员工，这一数字与过去两年持平，因为这家电子商务巨头正在为订单激增做准备。【原文：Amazon said it plans to hire 250,000 workers for the holiday season across its fulfillment and transportation networks in the U.S., the same number as the last two years, as the e-commerce behemoth prepares for a surge in orders.】

item.title: 肯尼亚议会通过加密资产法促进投资
item.description: 肯尼亚一位资深议员周一表示，肯尼亚立法者已经通过了一项监管加密货币等数字资产的法案，旨在通过为这一新兴行业制定明确的规则来促进对该行业的投资。【原文：Kenyan lawmakers have passed a bill to regulate digital assets like cryptocurrencies, a senior parliamentarian said on Monday, as it seeks to boost investments into the sector by putting clear rules in place for the emerging industry.】

item.title: a16z 支持的数据公司 Fivetran 和 dbt Labs 将通过全股票交易合并
item.description: 数据创业公司 Fivetran 和 dbt Labs 告诉路透社，两家公司将以全股票交易的方式合并，合并后将成为一家年收入近 6 亿美元的数据基础设施公司。【原文：Data startups Fivetran and dbt Labs will merge in an all-stock deal, creating a combined data infrastructure company with nearly $600 million in annual revenue, the two companies told Reuters.】

item.title: LMEWEEK Codelco 提高了对埃尔特尼恩特损失的估计，铜产量目标不变
item.description: Codelco 因其 El Teniente 矿事故造成的铜矿损失可能比之前估计的高出 45%，但董事长 Maximo Pacheco 仍预计这家全球最大的铜矿商今年的产量将略有增加。【原文：Codelco's copper losses from the accident at its El Teniente mine are likely to be 45% higher than previously estimated, but Chairman Maximo Pacheco still expects the world's largest copper miner to slightly increase output this year.】

item.title: Salesforce 将在五年内在旧金山投资 150 亿美元
item.description: 云软件供应商 Salesforce 周一表示，未来五年将在旧金山投资 150 亿美元，以支持该市的人工智能创新和劳动力发展。【原文：Cloud software provider Salesforce said on Monday it would invest $15 billion in San Francisco over the next five years to support artificial intelligence innovation and workforce development in the city.】

item.title: 在最新的芯片交易中，OpenAI 借助博通打造其首款人工智能处理器
item.description: OpenAI 已与博通公司（Broadcom）合作生产其首款内部人工智能处理器，这是该 ChatGPT 制造商的最新芯片合作，因为它正在努力确保所需的计算能力，以满足对其服务的激增需求。【原文：OpenAI has partnered with Broadcom to produce its first in-house artificial intelligence processors, the latest chip tie-up for the ChatGPT maker as it races to secure the computing power needed to meet surging demand for its services.】

item.title: HEDGEFLOW 对冲基金将重点转向全球工业股，抛售美国股票
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）在两份报告中称，对冲基金上周急于买入全球工业股票，抛售了美国股票，由于关税问题再次出现，美国股市周五遭遇了自4月份以来最严重的单日抛售。【原文：Hedge funds last week rushed into global industrial stocks and dumped U.S. equities, which on Friday suffered their worst one-day sell-off since April as tariff woes resurfaced, Goldman Sachs said in two notes.】

item.title: 美国财政部部长称政府关门打击经济
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周一在美国联邦政府关门进入第13天时表示，美国联邦政府关门已开始影响国家经济。【原文：The U.S. federal government shutdown is starting to impact the nation's economy, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Monday as the closure entered its 13th day.】

item.title: First Brands 首席执行官詹姆斯在破产进程中辞职，由扭亏专家负责
item.description: First Brands 周一表示，创始人帕特里克-詹姆斯（Patrick James）已辞去首席执行官一职，将由首席重组官查尔斯-摩尔（Charles Moore）临时接任，这家汽车零部件制造商正在推进破产保护程序。【原文：First Brands said on Monday founder Patrick James had stepped down as CEO and will be succeeded by Chief Restructuring Officer Charles Moore on an interim basis, as the auto parts maker advances its Chapter 11 bankruptcy process.】

item.title: Brookfield 以 30 亿美元收购 Oaktree 剩余股份，以加强信贷业务
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德（Brookfield）周一表示，将以约 30 亿美元的价格收购美国资产管理公司橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management）剩余的 26% 股份，这家投资公司正寻求加强其信贷业务。【原文：Brookfield said on Monday it would buy the remaining 26% stake in U.S.-based asset manager Oaktree Capital Management for about $3 billion, as the investment firm looks to strengthen its credit business.】

item.title: 可转换债务交换要约提前交割后，Beyond Meat 业绩下滑
item.description: 周一，Beyond Meat 股价暴跌超过 60%，这家以植物为原料的肉类生产商宣布提前结束可转换债券的交换要约，因为在多年的销售困境之后，该公司正寻求减少债务。【原文：Shares of Beyond Meat tumbled more than 60% on Monday after the plant-based meat maker announced an early settlement of an exchange offer for convertible bonds as it seeks to reduce debt following years of struggling sales.】

item.title: Salesforce 推出 Agentforce 360 AI 平台，促进软件产品发展
item.description: Salesforce 周一发布了其人工智能平台 "Agentforce 360"，该平台横跨云软件供应商的工具套件，旨在帮助客户实现日常任务自动化，吸引更多客户。【原文：Salesforce unveiled its artificial intelligence platform, "Agentforce 360", across the cloud software provider's suite of tools on Monday, aiming to help clients with automation of routine tasks and attract more customers.】

item.title: 铜价反弹需要中国推动才能创纪录
item.description: 10 月 9 日，铜价触及每吨 11,000 美元，这是伦敦金属交易所历史上仅有的两个交易日中出现过的里程碑，也让分析师们质疑铜价能否再创新高。【原文：Copper prices touched $11,000 per metric ton on October 9, a milestone seen on only two other trading days in the history of the London Metal Exchange - and one that has analysts questioning whether the metal can scale a new peak.】

item.title: 欧佩克维持石油需求展望，指出 2026 年供应缺口将缩小
item.description: 欧佩克（OPEC）周一未对其今明两年相对较高的全球石油需求增长预测做出任何改变，并暗示随着欧佩克+集团（OPEC+ Group）继续增产，2026年石油市场的供应缺口将大大缩小。【原文：OPEC made no changes on Monday to its relatively high global oil demand growth forecasts for this year and next, and implied the oil market will see a much smaller supply deficit in 2026 as the wider OPEC+ group pushes ahead with output increases.】

item.title: 特朗普即将对中国征收 100% 关税，美国零售商做好应对准备
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对中国进口商品征收 100%的额外关税，这给零售和贸易专家敲响了警钟，他们警告说，这可能会导致更多的价格上涨并挤压需求。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's threat of additional 100% tariffs on Chinese imports has sounded alarm bells among retail and trade experts, who caution it could lead to more price increases and squeeze demand.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德与 Bloom Energy 将启动高达 50 亿美元的人工智能基础设施合作项目
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）周一表示，将向布鲁姆能源公司（Bloom Energy）的燃料电池技术投资高达 50 亿美元，为人工智能（AI）数据中心提供动力。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management said on Monday it will invest up to $5 billion in Bloom Energy's fuel cell technology to power artificial intelligence (AI) data centers.】

item.title: 意大利与 KKR 就电信网络问题僵持不下
item.description: 四位接近此事的消息人士告诉路透社，意大利正与美国投资公司 KKR 就这家由国家支持、管理着该国主要电信网络的公司的未来陷入僵局。【原文：Italy is at loggerheads with U.S. investment firm KKR over the future of the state-backed firm which manages the country's main telecom network, four sources close to the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: Cerebras 旨在为大规模阿联酋星际之门数据中心枢纽部署人工智能基础设施
item.description: 人工智能芯片初创公司 Cerebras Systems 首席执行官安德鲁-费尔德曼（Andrew Feldman）周一告诉路透社，该公司的目标是将其基础设施部署到阿拉伯联合酋长国，以支持这个海湾国家快速增长的人工智能行业以及印度和巴基斯坦市场。【原文：AI chip startup Cerebras Systems aims to deploy its infrastructure to the United Arab Emirates to support the Gulf state's rapidly growing AI sector, as well as markets in India and Pakistan, CEO Andrew Feldman told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 德国当局取缔 1,400 个用于网络交易欺诈的网站
item.description: 德国官员周一在一份联合声明中说，德国调查人员和银行业监管机构 BaFin 已经关闭了东欧 1400 多个涉及网络交易欺诈的非法域名。【原文：German investigators and banking watchdog BaFin have shut down over 1,400 illegal domains in Eastern Europe that were involved in cybertrading fraud, officials said in a joint statement on Monday.】

item.title: 美国银行将 2026 年金价预期上调至 5,000 美元/盎司
item.description: 美国银行全球研究部周一上调了贵金属价格预测，将2026年黄金价格展望上调至每盎司5,000美元，平均价格约为4,400美元。【原文：Bank of America Global Research on Monday raised its price forecasts for precious metals, lifting its 2026 outlook for gold to $5,000 an ounce, with an average of around $4,400.】

item.title: 美国 市场在循环往复的叙述中回调
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 美国银行将 2026 年黄金预测值上调至 5,000 美元/盎司，认为白银价格为 65 美元
item.description: 美国银行周一上调了贵金属价格预期，将 2026 年黄金价格预期上调至每盎司 5,000 美元，平均为 4,400 美元；白银价格预期上调至每盎司 65 美元，平均为 56.25 美元。【原文：Bank of America on Monday raised its price forecasts for precious metals, lifting its 2026 outlook for gold to $5,000 an ounce, with an average of $4,400, and for silver to $65 an ounce, averaging $56.25.】

item.title: 高盛领导层重组，交易暂停，资深银行家流失
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的消息人士透露，在内部动荡和 2025 年低迷的开局驱使下，高盛今年已流失了十多位高级投资银行家，人数高于正常水平。【原文：Goldman Sachs has lost more than a dozen senior investment bankers this year, a higher number than normal, after internal shakeups and a sluggish start to 2025 drove them to seek new opportunities, according to three sources familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，微软和软银正在洽谈向英国 Wayve 公司投资 20 亿美元事宜
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一援引消息人士的话报道，英国自动驾驶技术集团 Wayve 正在与微软和软银谈判，希望筹集最多 20 亿美元的资金，这可能使该公司的估值达到约 80 亿美元。【原文：British autonomous driving technology group Wayve is in talks with Microsoft and SoftBank to raise up to $2 billion in funding, which could value the firm at about $8 billion, the Financial Times reported on Monday, citing sources.】

item.title: StubHub获得分析师认可，缓解了上市后的紧张情绪
item.description: StubHub Holdings 的股价在周一的盘前交易中上涨了近 5%，因为华尔街分析师支持该票务平台的长期增长潜力，尽管该股在上个月的首次亮相中表现不佳。【原文：StubHub Holdings' shares rose nearly 5% in premarket trading on Monday, as Wall Street analysts backed the ticketing platform's potential for long-term growth despite the stock's rocky debut last month.】

item.title: 特斯拉上海千兆工厂第四季度开始增产
item.description: 特斯拉副总裁林涛周一在微博中表示，特斯拉全球最大的制造中心--上海千兆工厂已开始在第四季度加速生产。【原文：Tesla 's Shanghai gigafactory, its largest manufacturing hub globally, has begun production ramp-up in the fourth quarter, Tesla vice president Tao Lin said in a Weibo post on Monday.】

item.title: 摩根大通推出 1.5 万亿美元计划，促进对美国战略产业的投资
item.description: 摩根大通周一推出了一项 1.5 万亿美元的计划，旨在促进、资助和投资被认为对美国国家安全和经济恢复能力至关重要的行业，包括国防、能源和先进制造业。【原文：JPMorgan Chase launched a $1.5 trillion plan on Monday to facilitate, finance and invest in industries deemed critical to the U.S. national security and economic resilience, including defense, energy and advanced manufacturing.】

item.title: 国际航空运输协会称，2025 年航空公司供应链将面临 110 亿美元的冲击
item.description: 一家领先的行业组织周一表示，全球航空公司今年将因供应链中断而面临超过 110 亿美元的额外成本，这份报告很可能会再次引发人们对价值 2,500 亿美元的航空业竞争问题的讨论。【原文：Global airlines face more than $11 billion in extra costs from supply chain disruption this year, a leading industry group said on Monday, in a report likely to rekindle debate over competition in the $250-billion aerospace industry.】
